libsFunctions.label: pR
libsFunctions.detail: void pR(inout vec2 p, float a) [hg.glsl]

documentation.value:
Rotate around a coordinate axis (i.e. in a plane perpendicular to that axis) by angle <a>.
Read like this: R(p.xz, a) rotates "x towards z".
This is fast if <a> is a compile-time constant and slower (but still practical) if not.

void pR(inout vec2 p, float a)

libsFunctions.detail: void pR45(inout vec2 p) [hg.glsl]

documentation.value:
Shortcut for 45-degrees rotation

libsFunctions.label: pMod1
libsFunctions.detail: float pMod1(inout float p, float size) [hg.glsl]

documentation.value:
Repeat space along one axis. Use like this to repeat along the x axis:
<float cell = pMod1(p.x,5);> - using the return value is optional.

float pMod1(inout float p, float size)

Same, but mirror every second cell so they match at the boundaries

libsFunctions.label: pModSingle1

Repeat the domain only in positive direction. Everything in the negative half-space is unchanged.

documentation.value:
The "Chamfer" flavour makes a 45-degree chamfered edge (the diagonal of a square of size <r>):

float fOpUnionChamfer(float a, float b, float r)

libsFunctions.label: fOpIntersectionChamfer
libsFunctions.detail: float fOpIntersectionChamfer(float a, float b, float r) [hg.glsl]

documentation.value:
Intersection has to deal with what is normally the inside of the resulting object
when using union, which we normally don't care about too much. Thus, intersection
implementations sometimes differ from union implementations.

float fOpIntersectionChamfer(float a, float b, float r)

libsFunctions.detail: float fOpDifferenceChamfer(float a, float b, float r) [hg.glsl]

Difference can be built from Intersection or Union:

libsFunctions.label: intersect
libsFunctions.detail: vec4 intersect(vec3 ro, vec3 rd) [raymarching_vec3.glsl]

documentation.value:
Marches along a ray and returns a vec4 where:
x = distance to closest surface
y = closeness to the surface (negative if inside)
z = material id (-1.0 for none)
w = emissive (0.0 for none)

vec4 intersect(vec3 ro, vec3 rd)
